title: Kaldi's Coffee - Two People

parameters.grind_size: Medium-fine, slightly coarser than single serving to prevent over-extraction.

preparation_steps: Grind 32 grams of coffee to medium-fine consistency.
Place filter in V60 and rinse with hot water to pre-heat and remove paper taste. Discard rinse water.
Add 32 grams of ground coffee, gently shake to level, and create a deep divot in the center.

brewing_steps.instruction: Bloom: Pour 80mL of water (2.5x coffee weight) into the divot, then move circularly to the outside grounds. Swirl the brewer immediately to distribute water, then stir through the bed to break up dry pockets.
brewing_steps.audio_script: Pour 80 milliliters of hot water directly into that center divot. Pour slowly and steadily, watching as the coffee begins to bloom and release carbon dioxide. Move circularly to the outside grounds, then give the V60 a gentle swirl to distribute water evenly. Stir through the bed to break up any dry pockets.

brewing_steps.instruction: Main Pour: Pour aggressively, full tilt, directly into the middle, then swirl out to the edge. Aim for 150mL in this stage, reaching 230mL total. This breaks channels and raises slurry temperature.
brewing_steps.audio_script: You have 25 seconds for the main pour - this is where V60 technique truly shines. Pour aggressively, full tilt, directly into the middle, then swirl out to the edge. We're aiming for 150 milliliters in this stage, reaching 230 total. This aggressive pour breaks channels and raises slurry temperature.

brewing_steps.instruction: Stop pouring and give a gentle swirl to flatten the bed.
brewing_steps.short_instruction: Stop pouring • Gentle swirl to flatten bed
brewing_steps.audio_script: In 20 seconds, stop pouring and set your kettle aside. Take a moment to pause and observe the coffee bed. Notice how it's actively bubbling and extracting. Now give your V60 dripper a gentle swirl to flatten the coffee bed for even distribution.

brewing_steps.instruction: Final Pour: Begin pouring very gently in the center, maintaining the water level with small circles, until 512mL is reached. The water above the coffee may become clear.
brewing_steps.audio_script: Now for the final pour! Take 40 seconds to pour very gently in the center, maintaining the water level with small circles. Work your way up to 512 milliliters total. Watch your scale closely - the water above the coffee may become clear as extraction continues.

brewing_steps.instruction: Give one more slight swirl to flatten the bed for drain down.
brewing_steps.short_instruction: Final swirl • Flatten bed for drain
brewing_steps.audio_script: Finally, give your V60 dripper one last gentle swirl to flatten the coffee bed completely. You have the remaining time for the coffee to drain completely at its natural pace. This should finish right around the 4 minute 45 second mark.

what_to_expect.description: Kaldi's Coffee V60 method for two people scales up beautifully while maintaining the same beginner-friendly approach. This technique uses a 2.5:1 bloom ratio with 32 grams of coffee, followed by an aggressive main pour and a gentle final pour to reach 512 milliliters. The larger dose requires slightly coarser grinding to prevent over-extraction. Expect a clean, balanced cup with good body and clarity, perfect for sharing. The aggressive main pour creates turbulence for even extraction across the larger coffee bed, while the gentle final pour ensures consistent results. This method works well with medium to dark roasts and is ideal for morning coffee sessions with a partner.

notes: Total Brew Time: 4:45 (285s). Perfect for 2 people. Slightly coarser grind prevents over-extraction with larger dose.
